intro: Lesquerella occidentalis var. cinerascens, commonly known as the silverleaf lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the Brassicaceae family, also known as the mustard family, and is known for its production of specialized oils. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks. The species is of interest for its potential applications in biochemistry and agriculture due to its unique seed oils.
